mapper.select: SELECT user.UserId AS userid, user.UserName AS username, user.CreditsCore AS creditscore , user.UserLoginTime AS userlogintime, count(productslog.UserId) AS browseCount, sum(productslog.IsShop)/count(productslog.UserId) AS ratio FROM user LEFT JOIN productslog ON (user.UserId=productslog.UserId) GROUP BY user.UserId;
SELECT COUNT(*) AS totaluserrecord FROM (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM user,productslog WHERE user.UserId=productslog.UserId GROUP BY user.UserId) userrecord

SELECT user.UserName username, `order`.OrderId orderid, `order`.AmountPay amountpay, `order`.TotalCredit totalcredit, `order`.EndTime createtime, GROUP_CONCAT(product.ProductName) products FROM `order` INNER JOIN orderproduct ON (`order`.OrderId=orderproduct.OrderId) INNER JOIN product ON (product.ProductId=orderproduct.ProductId) INNER JOIN user ON (order.UserId=user.UserId) WHERE `order`.UserId=#{id} GROUP BY `order`.OrderId;

SELECT user.UserName username, userlog.StartLoginTime startlogintime, userlog.EndLoginTime endlogintime, userlog.UserIp userip FROM user LEFT JOIN userlog ON (user.UserId=userlog.UserId) WHERE user.UserId=#{id};

SELECT user.UserId AS userid, user.UserName AS username, user.CreditsCore AS creditscore , user.UserLoginTime AS userlogintime, count(productslog.UserId) AS browseCount, sum(productslog.IsShop)/count(productslog.UserId) AS ratio FROM user LEFT JOIN productslog ON (user.UserId=productslog.UserId) WHERE user.username LIKE '%${_parameter}%' GROUP BY user.UserId
